meanings.definition: To surpass in skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outmaster her opponents in chess.
meanings.sent2: The athlete trained hard to outmaster his competitors in the race.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried to outmaster the clever cat in finding hidden nuts.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to outmaster the criminal's cunning plan.
meanings.sent5: In order to win the game, you must outmaster your opponent.

meanings.definition: A person who surpasses others in skill or ability.
meanings.sent1: He is known as the outmaster of the archery competition.
meanings.sent2: The outmaster of the cooking contest impressed the judges with her skills.
meanings.sent3: The outmaster of puzzles always solves them in record time.
meanings.sent4: The outmaster of disguise could fool anyone with her costumes.
meanings.sent5: The outmaster of strategy led his team to victory in the tournament.
